;On November 14, Hurun Research Institute and the Business Women's Growth and Social Platform Hong Kong Beauty Club jointly released the "2023 Hong Kong Beauty Club·Hurun Women Entrepreneurs List" (hereinafter referred to as the "Hurun Women Entrepreneurs List") as shown above information. This is the eighteenth consecutive time that Hurun Research Institute has released this list, and the deadline for wealth calculation is September 1, 2023. Unlike the Hurun Rich List, the list of female entrepreneurs separately calculates the personal wealth of female entrepreneurs that can be separated from family wealth.

;

;94-year-old "No. 1 Tenant" Kuang Xiaoqing became the richest woman in China

;

; "In the past 18 years, the threshold for the top 50 Chinese female entrepreneurs has increased from 500 million to 13.5 billion , increased nearly 30 times." Hurun Report, chairman and chief research officer of Hurun Report, said above. However, judging from the Hurun Report's overall list, the proportion of female entrepreneurs dropped by 1.3 percentage points to 25.4%.

;

;The Hurun Women Entrepreneurs List shows that 94-year-old Kuang Xiaoqing became the richest woman in China for the first time with a wealth of 72 billion yuan. She is also the sixth richest woman in China in the past 18 years on the Hurun Women Entrepreneurs List. The top five are Zhang Yin (three times) ), Yang Huiyan (ten times), Wu Yajun (twice), Zhou Qunfei (once), Chen Lihua (once). Wu Yajun, the founder of Longfor Real Estate, remains the richest self-made woman in China with 66.5 billion yuan.

;

;;;

; (Hurun Female Entrepreneurs List TOP10, Source: Hurun Report)

;

;Public information shows that Kuang Xiaoqingsheng Born in Huashan Town, Huadu District, Guangdong Province in 1929, she is the wife of Hong Kong entrepreneur and founder of Sun Hung Kai Properties, Kwok Desheng, with a total wealth of 72 billion yuan. She is also the largest shareholder of Sun Hung Kai Properties. She is highly respected in the family and is the soul of Sun Hung Kai Properties.

;

;Sun Hung Kai Properties is one of the largest real estate developers in Hong Kong. According to data from Sun Hung Kai Properties in fiscal year 2023 (July 1, 2022 to June 30, 2023), the company’s operating income was HK$71.2 billion. Net profit attributable to the parent company was HK$23.91 billion, with a net profit margin of 34.52%, a year-on-year increase of 2.7%.

;

;Kuang Xiaoqing is known as "China's No. 1 Housekeeper". Judging from the financial reports of Sun Hung Kai Properties in the past five years, property rental has always contributed the largest proportion of revenue, about one-third. Judging from the latest financial report, as of June 30, 2023, Sun Hung Kai Properties' land bank in Hong Kong is approximately 58 million square feet (approximately 5.38 million square meters), of which more than 60% are diversified properties, most of which are used for Leasing and long-term investment bring considerable recurring income to the group.

;

;According to Hurun Report, Kuang Xiaoqing became the richest woman in China for the first time, mainly benefiting from the rise in the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate this year and company dividends.

;

;Judging from the rise in the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate, since the beginning of this year, the RMB exchange rate against the Hong Kong dollar has risen from around 0.8 to around 0.9, with a maximum of around 0.93.

;

;Judging from the company's dividends, Flush shows that Sun Hung Kai Properties is one of the blue-chip stocks that have been purchased the most by domestic investors, with a cumulative cash distribution of HK$71.72 billion in the past five years. In fiscal year 2023 (July 1, 2022 to June 30, 2023), the company will distribute cash twice, with an amount of HK$14.34 billion, and a dividend payout ratio of 60%.

;

;It is worth noting that in the latest fiscal year (dividend payment date is November 16), Sun Hung Kai Properties paid a dividend of HK$3.7 per share, which was three times the dividend of the previous fiscal year. Kwong Xiaoqing personally holds less than 0.01% of Sun Hung Kai Properties, which is 25,020 shares. Kwong Xiaoqing and his immediate family members jointly hold 19.5% of Sun Hung Kai Properties' shares, totaling 565 million shares. Based on a dividend payout of HK$3.7 per share, Kuang Xiaoqing’s personal shareholding and the shareholding jointly held with others will make a profit of approximately HK$2.091 billion.

;

;The ranking of "Ten Crowns" Yang Huiyan dropped to fifth place

;

;In this list, another major focus is the substantial wealth of Yang Huiyan, who has won the title of the richest woman ten times. Shrunk, ranking fell to fifth.

;

;Judging from the changes in the Hurun Women Entrepreneurs list, Country Garden Chairman and Executive Director Yang Huiyan’s wealth has shrunk the most in 2023 compared to last year (27 billion yuan), ranking 5th with 48 billion yuan; followed by It is Cheng Xue, CEO of Haitian Flavor Industry, whose performance has declined due to the additive incident, and his wealth has shrunk by 16.5 billion yuan; and Zhao Yan, chairman of Bloomage International Investment Group, the "Queen of Hyaluronic Acid", whose wealth has shrunk by 14.5 billion yuan.

;

;Born in 1981, Yang Huiyan is the second daughter of Country Garden founder Yang Guoqiang. In 2005, Yang Huiyan returned to China after graduating from the Ohio State University majoring in marketing and logistics, and joined Country Garden as Yang Guoqiang's personal assistant and served as purchasing manager. She has held important positions in Country Garden Investment Center, Procurement Department, Human Resources Center, Digital Management Center and other departments. In March 2023, Yang Huiyan officially became the successor of the family business and served as the chairman of the board of directors of Country Garden.

;

;In April 2007, Country Garden was listed in Hong Kong, and Yang Guoqiang transferred all his shares to Yang Huiyan. 26-year-old Yang Huiyan topped the 2007 Forbes rich list with $16.02 billion, and became China's new richest woman. In the 16 years from 2007 to 2022, Yang Huiyan aspired to be the richest woman in China ten times. It is worth noting that Yang Huiyan’s wealth has shrunk by nearly 60% year-on-year in 2022, but she still ranks first.

;

;;;

;(Yang Huiyan aspired to be the richest woman in China ten times, source: Hurun Report) 

;

;Yang Huiyan’s wealth has shrunk and Country Garden Crisis is closely related. In 2023, due to increasing uncertainty in the macro economy and real estate, Country Garden's debt has frequently shown red lights. "Faced with the two-way tightening on the consumer side and the financing side, the group's liquidity is under unprecedented pressure." Country Garden said in its 2023 mid-term report. From Country Garden's annual and interim reports for the past five years, we can find that Country Garden's strategic goals have changed from prudent and pragmatic replenishment of high-quality land reserves to "guaranteing the delivery of buildings" and making every effort to arrange debt repayments.

;

;On July 30, 2023, Country Garden Services (6098.HK) announced that Yang Huiyan, the company’s controlling shareholder, non-executive director and chairman of the board of directors, donated RMB 64 million to Guoqiang Charity Foundation (Hong Kong) Co., Ltd. HK$100 million worth of stocks will be used for charity. But this move caused controversy in the market.

;

;In addition, the Hurun Women Entrepreneurs List shows that the number of new female billionaires on the list is 8, which is the lowest in 18 years and 3 less than last year. Among the newcomers, the top one is Zhou Chaonan of Runze Technology, which is engaged in the big data center and computing infrastructure industry, with a wealth of 20 billion yuan; followed by Shu Ping, one of the founders of Haidilao, with a wealth of 18 billion yuan; and then Yulon of Taiwan. Car boss Yan Chen Lillian has a fortune of 16 billion yuan. Newcomers also include Ye Qiongjiu, director and deputy general manager of Tonghuashun, with a wealth of 13.5 billion yuan.  

;

;Nearly 60% of female entrepreneurs started from scratch. Real estate is still the largest source of wealth

;

;From the perspective of wealth sources, nearly 60% of female entrepreneurs started from scratch, and nearly 40% inherited it. .  

;

;Specifically, the Hurun Female Entrepreneurs List shows that there are 34 self-made female entrepreneurs in 2023, accounting for 59%, which is basically the same as last year; 24 are not self-made, 2 fewer than last year position, accounting for 41%, compared with 43% last year.  

;

;Self-made female entrepreneurs mainly start their own businesses or start businesses with their husbands. For example, Wu Yajun of Longhu, Chen Lihua of Fuhua and Wang Laichun of Luxshare Precision, Fan Hongwei of Hengli, Guan Yamei of Tongwei and Pan Dong of Blue Moon, etc. Non-self-made female entrepreneurs, on the one hand, inherit wealth, such as Zong Fuli of Wahaha, Yang Huiyan of Country Garden, etc.; on the other hand, they are the widows of entrepreneurs.

;

;In terms of age, the average age of self-made female entrepreneurs is about 59 years old, and the average age of successors is 54 years old.  The wealth of the 7 post-80s generation on the list is all inherited. They are: Yang Huiyan, 42, from Country Garden, Yan Xin, 40, from Sushang, Zong Fuli, 41, from Wahaha, and 40-year-old Dali Foods. Xu Yangyang, 36-year-old Ruan Zeyun of Flat Glass, 39-year-old Luo Yi of Hesheng and 35-year-old Jin Junmiao of JA Solar Technology.

;

;From the perspective of the industries in which female entrepreneurs work, real estate is still the largest source of wealth for female entrepreneurs, accounting for 17% of the people on the list, the same as last year; energy and consumer goods tied for second, accounting for 13%; food and beverage, non-ferrous metals, health and other industries all increased, while the chemical industry and investment industry declined. ; ;

;

;;

;

;

;In addition, Hurun said: "The female entrepreneurs who performed well this year mainly come from the Apple industry chain, including Zhou Qunfei of Lens Technology and Zeng Fangqin of Lingyi Intelligent Manufacturing; secondly, thanks to the post-epidemic The entertainment and catering industries are recovering, such as He Chaoqiong of MGM China, Li Haiyan and Shu Ping of Haidilao; the third is Ma Dongmin of Baidu, etc. driven by ChatGPT."

; Wed, 15 Nov 2023 17:55:04 +0800 教育不是功名利禄的“油门”，而是做人做事的“把门”http://www.infzm.com/contents/260571
;;2023-11-15 17:00:00;
;

;The third uncle came to me to complain, saying that he had helped his cousin pay off a debt of 10,000 yuan, and then sighed as usual "It's better for you to study", the word "ah" is a long sigh, which contains many thoughts of the third uncle.

;

;Going back twenty years, Uncle San’s attitude towards studying was not a “good” one, but his own judgment. He is a capable person, with great strength and a sharp mind. He can handle all kinds of farm work with ease. He can adapt immediately to work in the city. From skills to interpersonal skills, he can handle it with ease, making money and gaining popularity. Therefore, his family has the most prosperous life in the village and can be called the "richest man". He is a person who "stamps his feet in the east of the village and trembles in the west of the village".

;

;He often said that he had not studied for a few days and had not received any advanced education, but his life was better than others. Go to school and study, and ultimately you have to live a good life. As long as you live a good life, don't care too much whether you get an education or not. Therefore, when other families were worried about their children's poor grades, the third uncle was very indifferent and didn't care about his cousin's grades. He didn't praise his cousin if he got 100 points in the exam, and he didn't beat or scold him if he failed. He told his son, How many points you earn is not a matter of ability, the key is being able to make money. Uncle San has this attitude towards school education and instills this into family education - as long as you master the ability to make money, you will win.

;

;My third uncle is very disdainful of those families that invest too much money and energy in education, especially my family. Although the tuition fees at that time were not high, they were still a big burden for rural families. Before the start of each school year, many parents were worried about the tuition fees, and it would even take a long time after the school started to raise the funds. Uncle San didn’t understand the idea of ​​collecting tuition fees. Since he had no money, why would he still go to school? He went to elementary school, middle school, and university. After graduation, if he didn’t find a job or the job was not good, he would have to invest more than ten dollars. Wasn’t the money spent in the year wasted?

;

;Later, I performed abnormally in the high school entrance examination and felt that I could not reach the admission score. I was very depressed and lost. My relatives and friends could not come to comfort me. Only my third uncle came over and told me, don’t worry. In the worst case, I would learn to repair cars with him. Studying is easy and you can make money. It made me dumbfounded. Fortunately, it was just a false alarm. A month later, I successfully entered high school.

;

;Due to differences in educational concepts, the relationship between father and third uncle is very delicate. The two brothers often quarrel over this difference when eating and drinking, and break up on bad terms. My father was firm at first and kept encouraging me, saying that I should study even though I was selling everything. But as his cousin entered the society, his father's heart was shaken.

;

;Under the neglect of his third uncle, his cousin barely survived until he graduated from junior high school. Then he refused to go to school and wanted to go out to the city to try his luck. The third uncle expressed his support and entrusted him to a do-it-yourselfer. Relatives take care of business. The third uncle gave his cousin a sum of money and asked him to make the first pot of gold by himself. My cousin is not very old, but he has inherited the talents of his third uncle. Before he was 18 years old, he was already prosperous in the city, and at least he started taking money from the family. And I was still "burning money" in college at that time. Every time I came home for vacation, my father would always talk about the legend of my cousin getting rich, and his tone was full of admiration. Later, he gradually expressed his blame for my slow success in studying, from sighing to complaining, which made me afraid to appear at the same time as my cousin. .

;

;The reversal occurred in my second year on the job. My cousin started to get into debt. He liked to make rapid progress in business. In addition, he entered the society at an early age and gained stubborn self-confidence. He turned a deaf ear to the old man's advice. Moving money here and there and negotiating in the west have become the norm, and we are gradually unable to make ends meet. At first, the third uncle felt that the family was rich and the loss was nothing. But when he realized that something was wrong, it was too late. The cousin’s debts spanned both black and white, including relatives and friends. He was unable to repay them, so he owed it to the stronger third uncle. On the head.

;

;After going bankrupt, only one-tenth of the debt was paid. The third uncle, who has become a grandfather and enjoys his old age, decided to start over. He took up the craftsmanship of his youth and worked two or three jobs at the same time. He works hard and makes money to pay off his debts with amazing perseverance. Relatives' debts, bank loans... one after another, all relied on him and his third aunt to support the repayment. The cousin, who was used to wallowing in money, couldn't accept the life without money. He just settled down after falling into debt. His parents had to bear the huge burden. Even his own son was taken care of by an old man while working.

;

;This has been going on for ten years, and the debt has finally been repaid. I haven't changed much, I just keep going to and from get off work. The ones who have changed are my father and my third uncle. My father began to be grateful for his investment in education. Although I did not earn much money, I learned to be steady and not easy to "learn bad things", and he believed in me more than before. The third uncle began to repeat, "How good it is to study." Education costs money, but the money is worth spending, because those who study have a "doorkeeper" and something to pull them when doing things, and they will not keep "stepping on the accelerator". ", no matter what.

;

;Later I gradually understood that although education is not a panacea, it may not be able to directly solve very real problems such as employment and making money. But nothing is possible without education. We often think of education and society as a cause-and-effect relationship. Education must be responsible for what we can do when we enter society, otherwise it will be useless. In fact, a major function of education is to be responsible for what you do not do when you enter society. You should not just focus on "doing something", but also pay attention to "doing something not to do." Through the words of the third uncle, I think that regardless of family education, school education, or social education, if you focus on using education as the "gas pedal" for profit, you will definitely lose control. In an increasingly "fast" era, education is needed as the "brake" role.

;

;(The author is a Changchun media person)

;;Recently, a cliff was excavated in Nanjiang County, Bazhong, Sichuan more than 1,400 years ago in the late Northern Wei Dynasty. The statues were defaced and vandalized, causing concern. After seeing the pictures, netizens lamented: "It makes me want to cry. The protection of cultural relics has a long way to go.";

;

;;The daubed statue is a new discovery in 2021;

;

;;Pictures posted by netizens show that the statue has been painted colorfully. The rosettes, clothes, headdresses, and utensils in the hands of some statues are painted in different colors. ;

;

;;

;

;;

;

;A cliff statue in Nanjiang County after it was daubed (top picture) and before it was daubed (bottom picture)

;

;< img src="https://images.infzm.com/cms/medias/image/23/11/15/1ac7a7a97d55273821119a68f82869d3.jpeg" border="0" style="opacity: 1;" width="1080" height= "776" data-src="//images.infzm.com/cms/medias/image/23/11/15/1ac7a7a97d55273821119a68f82869d3.jpeg" data-key="258372">;

;

;; Relevant archaeological survey reports show that the statues here are newly discovered in 2021. In February 2022, the Bazhong Municipal Cultural Relics Bureau, the School of Archeology and Museum of Sichuan University, the Xi'an Forest of Steles Museum and the Nanjiang County Cultural Relics Protection Research Center jointly conducted an investigation of the cliff statues. The subsequent report concluded that:;

;

; "Cliff statues were rarely excavated in the late Northern Wei Dynasty, and were continued in the early Tang ;, Wu Zhou and middle and late Tang dynasties. The excavation date was early and the formation process was complicated. The entire natural stone package on the ground was excavated into a stele for the statue. The characteristic practice is an isolated example in Sichuan. These materials have very important academic value in completing the development sequence of Sichuan grottoes and revealing the Buddhist culture and art exchanges between Sichuan and the northern Central Plains.";

;

;;

;

;< img src="https://images.infzm.com/cms/medias/image/23/11/15/f853a85bd792a1975d1d34c3a761dd02.png" border="0" style="opacity: 1;" width="1080" height= "688" data-src="//images.infzm.com/cms/medias/image/23/11/15/f853a85bd792a1975d1d34c3a761dd02.png" data-key="258374">;

;

;;After another local cliff statue was daubed (top picture) and before it was daubed (bottom picture);

;

;; The cultural protection staff did not have time to stop it after discovering it;

;

;;The reporter called the Bazhong Municipal Cultural Relics Bureau. A staff member said that the incident happened two days ago, and he went to stop it after discovering it through surveillance. "Because it is in a barren mountain, they had already finished painting it when we arrived. The statue was discovered only two years ago and has not yet been included in the cultural protection unit. We have built a cultural relic shed and surveillance, but it is too far away." Inside the mountains, local protection capabilities are also limited. "

;

;The staff said that those who daubed the statues were all old men in their 70s and 80s, saying that they were "clothing the Bodhisattva and fulfilling his vows." "It is not easy for us to deal with it, we can only criticize and educate. "

;

;As to whether the statue can be restored to its original appearance, staff from the Bazhong Municipal Cultural Relics Bureau said that the paint used on the statue is mainly acrylic. Relevant experts have been invited to demonstrate, "It should be possible to restore it, and we will Strengthen publicity and education on cultural relics protection, and also call on everyone to increase awareness of cultural relics protection through the media. ”

;

;;Local report: The public security organs have intervened in the investigation;

;

;;In the early morning of the 15th, the Nanjiang County Cultural Relics Protection Research Center issued a report on the "Shifei River Cliff" Report on the situation of "the statues were painted":;

;

;;On November 13, some of the cliff statues in Shifeihe County were painted, which aroused widespread concern among netizens. After preliminary investigation, in November On the 6th, Li Mouhua, a resident of Langzhong City, Sichuan Province, entrusted Wang Mouguo, a villager of Jinyin Village, Chixi Town, Nanjiang County, Bazhong City (Li Mouhua’s mother) to ask Yue Moubang, a villager of Shehongzhai, Gaota Town, to investigate Some of the cliff statues in Shifeihe were painted with the words "dress to make a wish". After the incident, the local area immediately added protective measures to the site to prevent secondary damage caused by inappropriate behavior. At the same time, the public security organs are conducting investigations in accordance with the law.

;

;;On November 14, experts from the Sichuan Provincial Cultural Relics Bureau, the Institute of Cultural Relics and Archeology and the Bazhong Municipal Cultural Relics Bureau conducted on-site inspections and studied and formulated a protection and restoration plan. The Nanjiang County Cultural Relics Protection Research Center;; has Contact an institution with cultural relics appraisal qualifications to evaluate the value of the cliff statues and the losses caused by smearing. In the next step, our center will promptly announce the investigation, disposal and restoration status to the public.;;;

;

;;Some "unpopular" cultural relics are fading;

;

;;In fact, due to;;grassroots cultural relics protection;;power< /span>;;The quantity is relatively weak, and similar damage to cultural relics across the country;;is not uncommon.;

;

;;In the Forbidden City, the Summer Palace, and the Terracotta Warriors and Horses of Qin Shi Huang’s Mausoleum In addition to other famous scenic spots, ancient tombs in the mountains and forests, the Great Wall in the wilderness, Buddhist caves on the cliffs... In places we can't see, some "unpopular" cultural relics are fading, weathering, collapsing, and disappearing.;

;

;;< /p>;

;;B station UP owner @Heritage Jun was deeply touched by this. “In 2015, I visited nearly 20 ancient buildings in Shanxi, and most of them were dilapidated. Some wooden buildings in the Song and Yuan Dynasties had their entire roofs collapsed and their walls also collapsed. ”;

;

;;That’s when he decided to become a cultural relic sharing blogger. In the past 8 years, he visited more than 2,000 cultural relics and historic sites across the country and published more than 25,000 cultural relics Post.;

;

;;

;

;;In recent years, the country’s efforts to protect cultural relics have gradually increased. “I went to Shanxi again in the past two years and saw that the situation has improved a lot. As long as it is a 'national security unit', it has basically been restored and I can hardly recognize it anymore. ";

;

;;"National Protection Units", that is, key cultural relics protection units in the country, are directly allocated by the State Administration of Cultural Heritage for protection and are the most intensive. However, 767,000 places in our country cannot be protected. Among the movable cultural relics, only 5,058 are protected by the state, less than 0.7%.

;

;Those low-level cultural relics scattered in the countryside and mountains are more worrying.

;
